intro: Senecio podolianus, commonly known as the Podolian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio podolianus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
